definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
one able to do light manual labor only/semi-able-bodied or part time (farm) worker
working people/the workers of Socialist theory or of the glorious Chinese past
labor contract/contract between employer and employees governing wages and conditions
Rodong Sinmun (Workers' news), the official newspaper of the North Korean WPK's Central Committee
labor camp/prison camp with hard labor

sentences.english: Will men participate more in household duties?
sentences.chinese: 男性會更多地參與家務勞動嗎？

sentences.english: The laborers home from their fields spread their mats in the courtyards.
sentences.chinese: 勞動的人們從田間歸來，把席子展鋪在院子裏。

sentences.english: Vietnam, for example, has already been a beneficiary of escalating labor costs in China.
sentences.chinese: 例如越南已經成爲了中國勞動力成爲上升的受益者。

sentences.english: The State shall advocate that labourers practice individual insurance in form of saving account.
sentences.chinese: 國家提倡勞動者個人進行儲蓄性保險。

sentences.english: She blushed when they criticized her for her incorrect attitude toward labour.
sentences.chinese: 當他們批評她對勞動的不正確態度時，她臉紅了。

sentences.english: The law of value is determined by socially necessary labour time.
sentences.chinese: 價值規律是商品價值由社會必要勞動時間決定的規律。

sentences.english: I am a hardworker, have lots of energy and am a quick learner
sentences.chinese: 我是一個勤快的勞動者，學習能力強而且非常有活力。

sentences.english: Their employees enjoy life tenure and cannot be terminated.
sentences.chinese: 其員工享有職位終身制，無法終止勞動關係。

sentences.english: She blushed when we criticized he for incorrect attitude to ward labour.
sentences.chinese: 當我們批評她對待勞動的不正確態度時，她臉紅了。

sentences.english: You should never pay for your children's work.
sentences.chinese: 你從不應該爲孩子的勞動而付給他們用度。

sentences.english: They have flexibility in their labor markets.
sentences.chinese: 中國的勞動力市場非常有彈性。

sentences.english: To work a treadle . Or operate a lathe?
sentences.chinese: 一定要開車牀纔算勞動？

sentences.english: But long-term high unemployment will reduce the quality of the workforce.
sentences.chinese: 但長時間的高失業率會降低工人的勞動素質。

sentences.english: Women of middle and lower classer have been laboring in different trades and seeking for economic independence.
sentences.chinese: 中下層女子從事各種行業的勞動，謀求經濟自立。

sentences.english: Good relationship with the local labor bureau and government agencies.
sentences.chinese: 與本地勞動局及政府機關保持良好關係。

sentences.english: I extend my greetings to the working class of our country.
sentences.chinese: 我要向我們國家的勞動階級致敬。

definition: to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to sacrifice one's life/to sacrifice (sth valued)/beast slaughtered as a sacrifice
right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
